content5.ptxt: When the engine misfires, high concentrations of hydrocarbons (HC) enter the exhaust gas. Extremely high hydrocarbon concentration levels can cause an increase in exhaust emission levels. Extremely high concentrations of hydrocarbons can also cause increases in the three-way catalytic converter temperature, which may cause damage to the three-way catalytic converter. To prevent this increase in emissions and to limit the possibility of thermal damage, the ECM monitors the misfire count. When the temperature of the three-way catalytic converter reaches the point of thermal degradation, the ECM blinks the MIL. To monitor misfires, the ECM uses both the VVT sensor and the crankshaft position sensor. The VVT sensor is used to identify any misfiring cylinders and the crankshaft position sensor is used to measure variations in the crankshaft rotation speed. Misfires are counted when the crankshaft rotation speed variations exceed predetermined thresholds. If the misfire count exceeds the threshold levels, and could cause emission control system performance deterioration, the ECM illuminates the MIL and stores a DTC.

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Simultaneous misfiring of several cylinders occurs and either of the following conditions is met (2 trip detection logic):

item.ptxt: A misfire occurs that may damage the three-way catalytic converter (MIL blinks immediately when detected).
An emission deterioration misfire occurs (MIL illuminates).
Open or short in engine wire harness

data-name.name: mil
data-name.ptxt: *: The MIL flashes when a catalyst-damaging misfire is detected.

content5.ptxt: When DTCs for misfiring cylinders are randomly stored, but DTC P0300 is not stored, it indicates that misfires have been detected in different cylinders at different times. DTC P0300 is only stored when several misfiring cylinders are detected at the same time.
The ECM illuminates the MIL and stores a DTC when the following condition, which could cause emission deterioration, is detected (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: An excessive number of misfires (approximately 82 to 97 misfires per 1000 crankshaft revolutions) occurs a total of 4 times.

content5.ptxt: The ECM flashes the MIL (immediately detection logic) and stores a DTC (2 trip detection logic) when either one of the following conditions, which could cause damage to the three-way catalytic converter, is detected.

item.ptxt: At a high engine speed, a sufficient amount of misfires to damage the catalyst occurring within 200 crankshaft revolutions is detected once.
At a normal engine speed, a sufficient amount of misfires to damage the catalyst occurring within 200 crankshaft revolutions is detected 3 times.

entry.ptxt: Either of the following conditions is met
(a) Engine coolant temperature at engine start

table.title: Monitor Period of Catalyst-damaging Misfire (MIL Blinks)

item.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Record the DTC(s) and freeze frame data.
Clear the DTCs (even if no DTCs are stored, perform the clear DTC procedure).
Using the GTS, switch the ECM from normal mode to check mode.

Read the misfire count of each cylinder (Cylinder #1 Misfire Count to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count) with the engine idling. If any misfire count is displayed, skip the following confirmation driving pattern.
Drive the vehicle so that the vehicle conditions displayed in Misfire RPM and Misfire Load of the Data List are the same as the freeze frame data. Perform this step several times.

atten4.ptxt: In order to store misfire DTCs, it is necessary to operate the vehicle for the period of time shown in the table below, confirm the Misfire RPM and Misfire Load in the Data List.

item.ptxt: Check whether misfires have occurred by checking for DTCs and freeze frame data.

atten4.ptxt: Do not turn the ignition switch off until the output DTC(s) and freeze frame data have been recorded. When the ECM returns to normal mode (default), the stored DTC(s), freeze frame data and other data are cleared.

item.ptxt: Record the DTC(s), freeze frame data and misfire counts.
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Clear the DTCs (even if no DTCs are stored, perform the clear DTC procedure).

content5.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0102 for the mass air flow meter sub-assembly circuit.

atten3.ptxt: Inspect the fuses for circuits related to this system before performing the following procedure.

item.ptxt: If any DTCs other than misfire DTCs are output, troubleshoot those DTCs first.
If the misfire does not recur when the vehicle is brought to the workshop, reproduce the conditions stored in the ECM as freeze frame data.

If the misfire still cannot be reproduced even though the conditions stored in the ECM as freeze frame data have been reproduced, the following factors can be considered to be a possible cause of the problem:
There was insufficient fuel in the tank.
The spark plugs have been contaminated.
After finishing repairs, check the misfire counts of the cylinders (Cylinder #1 Misfire Count to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count).
Be sure to confirm that no misfiring cylinder DTCs are stored again by conducting the confirmation driving pattern after finishing repairs.
For 6 cylinder engine, the ECM intentionally does not set the specific misfiring cylinder DTCs at high engine speed. If misfires occur only in high engine speed areas, only DTC P0300 is set.
In the event of DTC P0300 being present, perform the following operations:
Start the engine and conduct the confirmation driving pattern.
Read the misfiring counts of each cylinder or DTC(s) using the GTS.
Repair the cylinder(s) that has a high misfiring rate or is indicated by the DTC.
After finishing repairs, conduct the confirmation driving pattern again, in order to verify that DTC P0300 is not set.
When one of Short FT B1S1, Long FT B1S1, Short FT B2S1 or Long FT B2S1 in the freeze frame data is outside the range of +/-15%, the air fuel ratio may be rich (-15% or less) or lean (+15% or higher).
When Coolant Temp in the freeze frame data is less than 75°C (167°F), the misfires have occurred only while warming up the engine.
An extremely imbalanced drive wheel which causes body vibration may cause misfire DTCs to be stored.

Read freeze frame data using the GTS. The ECM records vehicle and driving condition information as freeze frame data the moment a DTC is stored. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, if the air fuel ratio was lean or rich, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO MISFIRE DTCS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

entry.ptxt: DTC P0300, P0301, P0302, P0303, P0304, P0305 and/or P0306 are output
DTC P0300, P0301, P0302, P0303, P0304, P0305 and/or P0306 and other DTCs are output

atten4.ptxt: If any DTCs other than P0300, P0301, P0302, P0303, P0304, P0305 and/or P0306 are output, troubleshoot those DTCs first.

test1.ptxt: Check the PCV hose connections.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: PCV valve and hose are correctly connected and are not damaged.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MISFIRE RPM AND MISFIRE LOAD)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Misfire RPM and Misfire Load.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read and note the Misfire RPM and Misfire Load values.

atten4.ptxt: The Misfire RPM and Misfire Load values indicate the vehicle conditions under which the misfire occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (CATALYST OT MF F/C)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Catalyst OT MF F/C.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value displayed on the GTS.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (PROHIBIT THE CATALYST OT MISFIRE PREVENT F/C)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Prohibit the Catalyst OT Misfire prevent F/C.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Prohibit the Catalyst OT Misfire prevent F/C

app-param-unit.app-param: Prohibit the Catalyst OT Misfire prevent F/C

test1.ptxt: Perform the Active Test.

atten3.ptxt: When performing the Active Test, make sure the vehicle is stopped and the engine is either idling or being revved within 3000 rpm.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (CYLINDER MISFIRE COUNT)

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and warm it up.

Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Cylinder #1 Misfire Count, Cylinder #2 Misfire Count, Cylinder #3 Misfire Count, Cylinder #4 Misfire Count, Cylinder #5 Misfire Count and Cylinder #6 Misfire Count.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and allow the engine to idle.

Read each value for Cylinder #1 Misfire Count to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count displayed on the GTS. If no misfire counts occur in any cylinders, perform procedure [A] and [B] and then check the misfire counts again.
Drive the vehicle with the Misfire RPM and Misfire Load noted in the "Read Value Using GTS (Misfire RPM And Misfire Load)" procedures above [A].

Read each value for Cylinder #1 Misfire Count to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count displayed on the GTS. If no misfire counts occur in any cylinders, perform procedure [A] and [B] and then check the misfire counts again.

test2.ptxt: Drive the vehicle with the Misfire RPM and Misfire Load noted in the "Read Value Using GTS (Misfire RPM And Misfire Load)" procedures above [A].
Read the Cylinder #1 Misfire Count to Cylinder #6 Misfire Count or DTCs displayed on the GTS [B].

entry.ptxt: Most misfires occur in only 1 or 2 cylinders
3 cylinders or more have equal misfire counts

item.ptxt: If it is difficult to reproduce misfires for each cylinder, check the Data List item called Misfire Margin. Try to find vehicle driving conditions that lower the Misfire Margin value. Values above 30% are considered normal.
If the freeze frame data record of the engine coolant temperature is less than 75°C (167°F), the misfire may be detected only when the engine is cold.
If the freeze frame data record of the Engine Run Time is below 120 seconds, the misfire may be detected immediately after the engine is started.

Click here
Perform a spark test.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If the result of the spark test is normal, proceed to the next step.

Click here

Connect the GTS to the DLC3.

Turn the GTS on.

Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / All Data / Engine Speed, MAF and Coolant Temp.

test1.ptxt: Allow the engine to idle until Coolant Temp reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Read MAF with the engine speed at 2000 rpm.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK VALVE TIMING (CHECK FOR LOOSE TIMING CHAIN AND JUMPED TEETH)

test1.ptxt: Remove the cylinder head cover sub-assembly and cylinder head cover sub-assembly LH.
Click here
Turn the crankshaft pulley, and align its groove with the "0" timing mark of the timing chain cover.
Check that the timing marks of the camshaft timing gear assemblies and camshaft timing sprockets are aligned with the timing marks of the bearing cap as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: If the timing marks are not as shown, turn the crankshaft one revolution clockwise.

specitem.ptxt: The timing marks on the camshaft timing gear assemblies and camshaft timing sprockets are aligned as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: If the result is not as specified, check for mechanical malfunctions that may have affected the valve timing, such as a jumped tooth or stretching of the timing chain.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE MALFUNCTIONING PARTS, COMPONENT AND AREA

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WHETHER DTC OUTPUT RECURS (MISFIRE DTCS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Turn the GTS on.
Drive the vehicle in accordance with the driving pattern described in Confirmation Driving Pattern.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.
Check the DTC judgment result.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR CONNECTION)

test1.ptxt: Check the connection and terminal contact pressure of connectors and wire harnesses between the mass air flow meter sub-assembly and ECM.
Click here

Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Turn the GTS on.
Drive the vehicle in accordance with the driving pattern described in Confirmation Driving Pattern.

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If the results of the inspections performed in steps 15 and 20 indicated no problem, proceed to the next step without replacing the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for at least 30 seconds.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Turn the GTS on.
Drive the vehicle in accordance with the driving pattern described in Confirmation Driving Pattern.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.
Check the DTC judgment result.
Check the fuel lines for leaks or blockage.

action.actiontitle: GO TO FUEL PUMP CONTROL CIRCUIT
